src:
Saša skrbi za 750 psov
Zapuščeni konjeniški klub v Nišu je dom potepuškim kosmatincem. Srbski dobrotnik s prostovoljnimi prispevki rešuje pasja življenja.
07 Nov 2019, 07:27 by E. B.



Za zdaj bivajo v zapuščenem konjeniškem klubu.



Pešić še nobenemu psu ni odrekel pomoči.


Presunljiva zgodba se je začela leta 2008, ko je Saša Pešić rešil leglo zapuščenih mladičev in jim ponudil dom. Kužki so odrasli, Pešićeva dobrota pa ni usahnila: Srb iz Niša tako v svojem zavetišču trenutno skrbi za kar 750 psov.V dobrem desetletju jih je posvojil in krute usode rešil skupno več kot 1200: številnim je našel nov dom, za preostale pa skrbi z nekaj prijatelji. Javnost ga je dodobra spoznala leta 2015, ko je spektakularno skočil z mostu, da bi iz vode rešil onemoglega psička, posnetek mimoidočega pa je na facebooku dosegel neverjetnih 63 milijonov ogledov.


Pešić še nobenemu psu ni odrekel pomoči.

Akcija mu je pomagala do prepoznavnosti, a kljub temu preživljanje toliko štirinožnih prijateljev ni mala malica: vsak mesec samo za pasjo hrano zapravi približno 10.000 evrov, veterinarski stroški in druga oskrba seveda dodajo svoje. 
Pomagajo le tujci
In čeprav je zgodba o dobrotniku v Srbiji dobro znana, Pešić, ki po imenu pozna prav vsakega varovanca, toži, da mu slava v domovini pomaga bore malo. Včasih se celo zdi, da mu je naredila medvedjo uslugo, kajti mnogi, naveličani hišnih ljubljencev, te v nočnih urah preprosto postavijo pred vrata njegovega zavetišča in izginejo.
1200 psov je že rešil ulice.
»Namesto da bi katerega od psov posvojili, se še svojega znebijo, ker vedo, da mu ne bom odrekel pomoči,« je jezen Pešić, ki mu olja na ogenj priliva še oblast, saj ga želi s štirinožno druščino vred odsloviti iz zapuščenega konjeniškega kluba, kjer je ustvaril zavetišče. Za zdaj mu je s peticijo uspelo obdržati pasjo streho nad glavo.
Namesto da bi kakšnega posvojili, mu še svojega pripeljejo.
A vprašanje je, kako dolgo bo še lahko vztrajal, kajti 750 psov potrebuje občutno več prostora, poudarja Pešić, čigar pozive za pomoč so k sreči slišali v tujini, za kar je hvaležen predvsem fenomenu družabnih omrežij. Po zaslugi dobrotnikov z drugih koncev sveta njegovi kosmati prijatelji živijo kolikor toliko dostojno, kdo ve, morda bo kmalu kdo primaknil večji znesek in jim zagotovil dom.

Sasha cares for 750 dogs
The abandoned equestrian club in Niš is home to stray furriers. A Serbian benefactor saves a dog's life through voluntary contributions.
07 Nov 2019, 07:27 by E. B.



For now, they are staying in an abandoned equestrian club.



Pesic has not denied any dog assistance.


The startling story began in 2008 when Sasa Pesic rescued a litter of abandoned puppies and offered them a home. The puppies are adults, but Pesic's goodness has not withered: the Serb from Niš is currently caring for as many as 750 dogs in his shelter. Over a decade, he adopted them and saved a total of over 1200 fatal fatalities: some friends. The public met him well in 2015 when he spectacularly jumped off a bridge to rescue a disabled puppy from the water, and a shot of the passerby took a whopping 63 million views on facebook.


Pesic has not denied any dog assistance.

The campaign helped make him famous, but spending so many four-legged friends is not a small snack: he spends about $ 10,000 each month on dog food, and veterinary expenses and other supplies naturally add up to their own.
Only strangers help
And although the story of the benefactor in Serbia is well known, Pesic, who knows just about every citizen by name, claims that his homeland fame helps him fight a little. At times, it even seems to do him a disservice, because many, fed up with pets, simply put you in front of his shelter at night and disappear.
1200 dogs have already cleared the streets.

But the question is how long he will be able to persist, since 750 dogs need significantly more space, emphasizes Pesic, whose calls for help have thankfully been heard abroad, for which he is particularly grateful to the phenomenon of social networks. Thanks to well-wishers from other corners of the globe, his furry friends are living as decent as they can, who knows, maybe soon someone will move a bigger amount and provide them with a home.
